intro: Muscari polyanthum, commonly known as the grape hyacinth, is a bulbous perennial plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It produces dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pale blue to deep violet. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm and prefers well-drained, sandy or loamy soils. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Muscari polyanthum is also valued for its ability to naturalize and form extensive colonies over time.
